sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Dropper Script Execution Via WScript/CScript
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects wscript/cscript executions of scripts located in user directories
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Margaritis Dimitrios (idea), Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Electron Application Child Processes
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious child processes of electron apps (teams, discord, slack, etc.). This could be a potential sign of ".asar" file tampering (See reference section for more information) or binary execution proxy through specific CLI arguments (see related rule)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: CurrentVersion Autorun Keys Modification
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Suspicious PowerShell Keywords
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects potentially suspicious keywords that could indicate the use of a PowerShell exploitation framework
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Perez Diego (@darkquassar), Tuan Le (NCSGroup)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocation From Script Engines
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious powershell invocations from interpreters or unusual programs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: RegAsm.EXE Execution Without CommandLine Flags or Files
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the execution of "RegAsm.exe" without a commandline flag or file, which might indicate potential process injection activity.
Usually "RegAsm.exe" should point to a dedicated DLL file or call the help with the "/?" flag.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: frack113

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g (rule), oscd.community (improvements)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Browser Execution In Headless Mode
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of Chromium based browser in headless mode
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Process Discovery With Get-Process
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Get the processes that are running on the local computer.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: frack113

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Uncommon Svchost Command Line Parameter
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects instances of svchost.exe running with an unusual or uncommon command line parameter by excluding known legitimate or common patterns.
This could point at a file masquerading as svchost, a process injection, or hollowing of a legitimate svchost instance.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Liran Ravich

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious File Access to Browser Credential Storage
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects file access to browser credential storage paths by non-browser processes, which may indicate credential access attempts.
Adversaries may attempt to access browser credential storage to extract sensitive information such as usernames and passwords or cookies.
This behavior is often commonly observed in credential stealing malware.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: frack113, X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems), Parth-FourCore

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: RegAsm.EXE Execution Without CommandLine Flags or Files

signature_matches.name: create or open mutex on Windows
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: create or open mutex on Windows
    namespace: host-interaction/mutex
    authors:
      - moritz.raabe@mandiant.com
      - anushka.virgaonkar@mandiant.com
      - mehunhoff@google.com
    scopes:
      static: instruction
      dynamic: call
    mbc:
      - Process::Create Mutex [C0042]
    examples:
      - Practical Malware Analysis Lab 01-01.dll_:0x10001010
  features:
    - or:
      - api: kernel32.OpenMutex
      - api: kernel32.CreateMutex
      - api: kernel32.CreateMutexEx
      - api: ntdll.NtCreateMutant
      - api: ntdll.NtOpenMutant
      - and:
        - format: dotnet
        - or:
          - api: System.Threading.Mutex::ctor
          - api: System.Threading.Mutex::OpenExisting
          - api: System.Threading.Mutex::TryOpenExisting

signature_matches.name: get common file path
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: get common file path
    namespace: host-interaction/file-system
    authors:
      - moritz.raabe@mandiant.com
      - michael.hunhoff@mandiant.com
      - anushka.virgaonkar@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: function
      dynamic: call
    att&ck:
      - Discovery::File and Directory Discovery [T1083]
    mbc:
      - Discovery::File and Directory Discovery [E1083]
    examples:
      - Practical Malware Analysis Lab 03-02.dll_:0x10003415
      - 972B219F18379907A045431303F4DA7D:0x404887
  features:
    - or:
      - api: kernel32.GetTempPath
      - api: kernel32.GetTempFileName
      - api: kernel32.GetSystemDirectory
      - api: kernel32.GetWindowsDirectory
      - api: kernel32.GetSystemWow64Directory
      - api: GetAllUsersProfileDirectory
      - api: GetAppContainerFolderPath
      - api: GetCurrentDirectory
      - api: GetDefaultUserProfileDirectory
      - api: GetProfilesDirectory
      - api: GetUserProfileDirectory
      - api: SHGetFolderPathAndSubDir
      - api: shell32.SHGetFolderPath
      - api: shell32.SHGetFolderLocation
      - api: shell32.SHGetKnownFolderPath
      - api: shell32.SHGetSpecialFolderPath
      - api: shell32.SHGetSpecialFolderLocation
      - api: System.IO.Directory::GetCurrentDirectory
      - api: System.Environment::GetFolderPath
      - property/read: System.Environment::SystemDirectory
      - property/read: System.Environment::CurrentDirectory

signature_matches.name: delete registry value
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: delete registry value
    namespace: host-interaction/registry/delete
    authors:
      - michael.hunhoff@mandiant.com
      - anushka.virgaonkar@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: function

signature_matches.name: parse PE header
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: parse PE header
    namespace: load-code/pe
    authors:
      - moritz.raabe@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: function
      dynamic: unsupported  # requires mnemonic, operand[1].offset features
    att&ck:
      - Execution::Shared Modules [T1129]
    examples:
      - 9324D1A8AE37A36AE560C37448C9705A:0x403DD0
  features:
    - and:
      - os: windows
      - and:
        - mnemonic: cmp
        - or:
          - number: 0x4550 = IMAGE_NT_SIGNATURE (PE)
          - and:
            - number: 0x50
            - number: 0x45
        - or:
          - number: 0x5A4D = IMAGE_DOS_SIGNATURE (MZ)
          - and:
            - number: 0x4D
            - number: 0x5A
        - optional:
          - and:
            - operand[1].offset: 0x3C = IMAGE_DOS_HEADER.e_lfanew
            - or:
              - and:
                - arch: i386
                - operand[1].offset: 0x50 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS.OptionalHeader.SizeOfImage
                - operand[1].offset: 0x34 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS.OptionalHeader.ImageBase
              - and:
                - arch: amd64
                - operand[1].offset: 0x50 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS64.OptionalHeader.SizeOfImage
                - operand[1].offset: 0x30 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS64.OptionalHeader.ImageBase
          - basic block:
            - and:
              - operand[1].offset: 0x3C = IMAGE_DOS_HEADER.e_lfanew
              - 3 or more:
                - operand[1].offset: 0x4 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS.FileHeader.Machine
                - operand[1].offset: 0x6 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS.FileHeader.NumberOfSections
                - operand[1].offset: 0x14 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS.FileHeader.SizeOfOptionalHeader
                - operand[1].offset: 0x16 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS.FileHeader.Characteristics
                - operand[1].offset: 0x28 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS.OptionalHeader.AddressOfEntryPoint  # for 32 and 64 bit
                - or:
                  - and:
                    - arch: i386
                    - operand[1].offset: 0x34 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS.OptionalHeader.ImageBase
                    - operand[1].offset: 0x50 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS.OptionalHeader.SizeOfImage
                  - and:
                    - arch: amd64
                    - operand[1].offset: 0x30 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS.OptionalHeader.ImageBase
                    - operand[1].offset: 0x50 = IMAGE_NT_HEADERS64.OptionalHeader.SizeOfImage

          - optional:
            - instruction:
              - mnemonic: cmp
              - number: 0
